original: Almqvist, Axel Emanuel, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 5/4/88 i Lillhär-dal, Jämtl. 1., av pred. J. A. A. o. Agneta Barbara Andersdotter. G. 17 m. Hannde Hansison. Barn: Erik f. 18, civ:-ing., Eva 20, sjuksköt. — Stud :ex. i Västerås 08, fil. mag. 13, provår v. norra real i Sthlm 15. E. lär. i Härnösand 12, vik. ämneslär. i Avesta 13-14, lär. v. Sthlms borg:sk. 15, vik. adj. i Uddevalla 16, e. lär. v. Malmö reakk. 16-26, bitr. å rekt:exp. där 22-26, lär. i Malmö aftonsk. 25-26, adj. i Luleå 19, avsk. på begäran 20, adj. i mat em. o. fysik v. Hvitfeldts’ka h. a. 1. i Gbg sed. 25, bitr. å rekt:exp. där 26-31, vik. rekt. v. Malmö realsk. o. Hvit-feldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg somr. 26-31. Ordf. i Malmö-krets, av Sv:es extra-lär:fören. 21-26, sekr. i Gbgs lär:-sällsk. 26-29, byråförest, o. kassaför-valt. und. 29 års’ allm. sv. lärov:lär:-möte i Gbg, hed:led. i Sv:es extra-lär:fören. 28, led. av styr. f. Gbgs lä-rov:iär. sjukkasisa ’S’ed. 34, ordf. sed. 46, ’suppil. i lokalstyr. f. HvitfeMtsika h. a. 1. i Gbg 45. Skr.: medv. i Extra-lär. o. skolreformen (utg. av centr:-styr. f. Sv:es extralär :fören.), medv. m. avsn. Materia, krafter o. energi, Vågor o. strålar samt Värme o. elektricitet i Af ton,bl. Handbok (45). RVO 45.
translated: Almqvist, Axel Emanuel, teacher and lecturer, Gothenburg, born on April 5th, 1888 in Lillhärdal, Jämtland County, the son of the Reverend J.A.A. and Agneta Barbara Andersdotter. Married to Hannde Hansison, they have two children: Erik, born in 1918 who worked as a civil engineer, and Eva, born in 1920 who worked as a nurse. Almqvist passed his student exam in Västerås in 1908, became a Bachelor of Arts in 1913 and spent his trial year at the Northern Real School in Stockholm in 1915. He worked as a teacher in Härnösand in 1912, a temporary subject teacher in Avesta from 1913-1914, a teacher at the Stockholm City School in 1915, a temporary assistant in Uddevalla in 1916, a full-time teacher at Malmö grammar school from 1916-1926, an acting assistant principal there from 1922-1926, a teacher at the Malmö evening school in 1925-1926, a deputy head in Luleå in 1919, retired upon request in 1920. He then worked as a retired teacher in mathematics and physics at Hvitfeldts' School in Gothenburg starting from 1921, became an acting assistant principal there from 1926 to 1931, and then an acting principal at Malmö High School and Hvitfeldts' School in Gothenburg from 1926 to 1931. Almqvist served as the chairman of the Malmö branch of the Swedish Extra Teachers' Association from 1921-1926 and the secretary of the Gothenburg Teachers' Society from 1926-1929. He was also the head of the office and treasurer of the 1929 General Swedish Teachers' Meeting in Gothenburg, honorary member of the Swedish Extra Teachers' Association in 1928, a member of the board of Gothenburg Teachers' Sanatorium from 1934, serving as chairman in 1946, and a member of the Local Authority for Hvitfeldts School in Gothenburg in 1945. Almqvist wrote articles for the Extra Teachers' Association and School Reform publication, and contributed chapters on Matter, Forces, Energy, Waves, Radiation, Heat, and Electricity in the Handbook of Natural Science (1945). He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1945.

structured.description: Axel Emanuel Almqvist was a Swedish teacher, lecturer, and acting principal. He was born on April 5th, 1888 in Lillhärdal, Jämtland County and is the son of the Reverend J.A.A. and Agneta Barbara Andersdotter. He studied at Västerås and became a Bachelor of Arts in 1913. Almqvist worked as a teacher in Härnösand in 1912, a temporary subject teacher in Avesta from 1913-1914, a teacher at the Stockholm City School in 1915, a temporary assistant in Uddevalla in 1916, a full-time teacher at Malmö grammar school from 1916-1926, an acting assistant principal there from 1922-1926, a teacher at the Malmö evening school in 1925-1926, a deputy head in Luleå in 1919, retired upon request in 1920. He then worked as a retired teacher in mathematics and physics at Hvitfeldts' School in Gothenburg starting from 1921, became an acting assistant principal there from 1926 to 1931, and then an acting principal at Malmö High School and Hvitfeldts' School in Gothenburg from 1926 to 1931. Almqvist contributed articles to the Extra Teachers' Association and School Reform publication and wrote chapters on Matter, Forces, Energy, Waves, Radiation, Heat, and Electricity in the Handbook of Natural Science (1945). He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1945.
